title: How to Make Cassava Cake

steps.headline: Preheat the oven to 180ºC  or 350ºF.
steps.description: Prepare a a 9”x13” cake pan or tin; either grease it or line with parchment paper.

steps.headline: In a mixing bowl, add the cassava, melted butter, evaporated milk, condensed milk, cheese, eggs, vanilla and sugar.
steps.description: Mix all the ingredients thoroughly until they reach an even consistency.

steps.headline: Add the coconut milk.
steps.description: Pour the batter in the cake pan or tin.

steps.headline: Bake for 45 to 50 minutes.
steps.description: Make sure the top of the cake is firm before removing it. Take out of the oven and set aside. Leave in the pan, sitting on a wire cooling rack.

steps.headline: Prepare the topping by mixing all the ingredients together in a saucepan over medium heat.
steps.description: Stir constantly until it becomes thick. Let the topping ingredients simmer for about a minute.

steps.headline: Pour the topping over the cake.
steps.description: Spread across the cake top evenly, with the use of a spatula.

steps.headline: Put in the oven again.
steps.description: Bake for another 15 minutes, or until the top turns golden brown.

steps.headline: Let it cool off before you cut into slices and serve.

text: Making the cake Preheat the oven to 180ºC  or 350ºF. Prepare a a 9”x13” cake pan or tin; either grease it or line with parchment paper. In a mixing bowl, add the cassava, melted butter, evaporated milk, condensed milk, cheese, eggs, vanilla and sugar. Mix all the ingredients thoroughly until they reach an even consistency. Add the coconut milk. Pour the batter in the cake pan or tin. Bake for 45 to 50 minutes. Make sure the top of the cake is firm before removing it. Take out of the oven and set aside. Leave in the pan, sitting on a wire cooling rack. Making the topping Prepare the topping by mixing all the ingredients together in a saucepan over medium heat. Stir constantly until it becomes thick. Let the topping ingredients simmer for about a minute. Pour the topping over the cake. Spread across the cake top evenly, with the use of a spatula. Put in the oven again. Bake for another 15 minutes, or until the top turns golden brown. Let it cool off before you cut into slices and serve. Enjoy! Finished.
sentences: Making the cake Preheat the oven to 180ºC  or 350ºF.
Prepare a a 9”x13” cake pan or tin; either grease it or line with parchment paper.
In a mixing bowl, add the cassava, melted butter, evaporated milk, condensed milk, cheese, eggs, vanilla and sugar.
Mix all the ingredients thoroughly until they reach an even consistency.
Add the coconut milk.
Pour the batter in the cake pan or tin.
Bake for 45 to 50 minutes.
Make sure the top of the cake is firm before removing it.
Take out of the oven and set aside.
Leave in the pan, sitting on a wire cooling rack.
Making the topping Prepare the topping by mixing all the ingredients together in a saucepan over medium heat.
Stir constantly until it becomes thick.
Let the topping ingredients simmer for about a minute.
Pour the topping over the cake.
Spread across the cake top evenly, with the use of a spatula.
Put in the oven again.
Bake for another 15 minutes, or until the top turns golden brown.
Let it cool off before you cut into slices and serve.
Enjoy!
Finished.
